TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy-skeletal, mixed, superactive Xeric Palecryolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Schuster loam, rangeland. (Colors are for moist 90il unless otherwise noted.)
O1--1 inch to 0; leaves.
All--0 to 6 inches; dark brown (7.5YR 3/2) loam, brown (10YR 4/3) dry; moderate fine granular structure soft, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; many very fine, fine and medium roots 10 percent gravel; slightly acid (pH 6.4); abrupt smooth boundary. (4 to 13 inches thick)
A12--6 to 12 inches; dark brown (7.5YR 3/2) loam, brown (10YR 4/3) dry; moderate medium granular structure; soft, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; many very fine, fine and medium roots; 10 percent gravel; slightly acid (pH 6.2); clear irregular boundary. (6 to 14 inches thick)
A2--18 to 29 inches; brown (7.5YR 4/4) gravelly fine sandy loam, strong brown (7.5YR 5/6) dry, weak fine and medium subangular blocky structure; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; common very fine, fine and medium roots; common fine pores; 25 percent gravel and 5 percent cobbles; medium acid (pH 6.0) clear wavy boundary. (8 to 18 inches thick)
B21t--29 to 44 inches; dark red (2.5YR 3/6) gravelly clay loam, red (2.5YR 4/6) dry; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; hard, firm, sticky and plastic; few very fine, fine and medium roots; common fine pores; common thin clay films on faces of peds; 40 percent gravel and 5 percent cobbles; medium acid (pH 6.0); abrupt wavy boundary. (9 to 19 inches thick)
B22t--44 to 63 inches; dark red (2.5YR 3/6) very gravelly clay loam, red (2.5YR 4/6) dry, moderate fine subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, sticky and plastic; few very fine and fine roots, few thin clay films; 65 percent gravel and 10 percent cobbles; slightly acid (pH 6.2).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Morgan County, Utah; about 3 1/4 miles south and 3 1/4 miles west of East Canyon Dam, 600 feet west and 70 feet north of the 51/4 corner of sec. 30, T.2N., R.3E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS: The mollic epipedon is 10 to 19 inches thick.  The combined thickness of the Al, A2 and B2t horizons is 47 to more than 60 inches. The upper 20 inches of the B2t horizon has 22 to 35 percent clay and 45 to 60 percent rock fragments. The mean annual soil temperature at depth of 20 inches ranges from 37 to 44 degrees F. The mean summer soil temperature ranges from 57 to 59 degrees F. The soils are usually moist, but are dry for 30 to 45 consecu-tive days during the later part of the summer. Rock fragments consist of quartzite and sandstone pebbles and cobbles, and range from 0 to 30 percent in the Al horizon, 20 to 50 percent in the A2 horizon, and 35 to 75 percent in the B2t horizon.
The Al horizon has hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 3 or 4 dry, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 2 or 3 dry. It is loam or gravelly loam. This horizon is slightly or medium acid and ranges from 10 to 19 inches thick.
The A2 horizon has hue of 7.5YR or 5YR, value of 4 through 7 dry, 4 or 5 moist, and chroma of 4 through 6 dry and moist. It ranges from gravelly fine sandy loam to gravelly, cobbly or very cobbly loam. This horizon is slightly to medium acid, and ranges from 8 to 18 inches thick.
The B2t horizon has hue of 2.5YR or 5YR, value of 4 or 5 dry, 3 through 5 moist, and chroma of 6 through 8 dry and moist. It ranges from very gravelly or cobbly loam to gravelly, very gravelly or very cobbly clay loam. This horizon is slightly to medium acid and is 21 to more than 40 inches thick.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES: These are the Charcol, Flygare, Lucky Star, Nordic and Norway Flat series. Charcol and Flygare soils have mollic epipedons more than 20 inches thick. Lucky Star soils have A&B horizons. Nordic soils have the upper boundary of the B2t horizon at depths of 40 to 46 inches and have hue of 10YR or 7.5YR in the B2t horizon. Norway Flat soils have gravelly sandy loam to gravelly sandy clay loam B2t horizons and have A&B horizons.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING: Schuster soils are at elevations of 5,800 to 8,200 feet. They occur on all aspects, of even or concave mountain slopes.  Slopes are 30 to 60 percent. These soils formed in residuum and local alluvium weathered from sandstone and conglomerate of sandstone and quartzite. The climate is humid and the average annual precipitation ranges from 25 to 30 inches. The mean annual temperature is 35 to 41 degrees F. The mean summer temperature is 55 to 59 degrees F. and the frost free period ranges from 60 to 75 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: ASSOCIATED SOILS: These are the Condie, Etchen, Henhoit and St. Marys soils, and the competing Charcol and Lucky Star soils. Condie and Etchen soils tack mollic epipedons. Henhoit and St. Marys soils lack A2 horizons and have summer soil temperature warmer than 59 degrees F.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY: Well drained; medium runoff; moderately slow permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION: These soils are used for rangeland,
wildlife habitat and watershed. The present native vegetation is oak, snowberry, bluebunch wheatgrass, bearded wheatgrass, balsamroot, native bluegrass, big sagebrush, mountain laurel and basin wildrye.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Northern Utah. The series is moderately extensive.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content:
SERIES ESTABLISHED: Morgan County, Morgan Area, Utah, 1974.
OSED scanned by NSSQA.  Last revised by state 11/74.
